column4: another question, do we need specific codec or something for MKV playback?
because i just recall installing the restricted extras
and not sure if that comes with mkv codec
so we dont need to install specific codecs or something(like in windows) to play mkv files properly?
it laggs as well, and sometimes closes itself
have you considered the issue may be related to something else? hardware?
the problem is that only in bntu i cannot play mkv. or hd files :(
in win7 i can play all HD files and mkv properly
if it was hardware, probably i will get same issue in win7, but only in Ubuntu i am facing it
yeap, so i am wondering if it is drivers/codec related issue not sure :(
I don't know that it would make a diff but I have never been without it, so its hard to tell
to be honest havent tried it
but you have intel's graphics card?
yeap, intel graphics on a cheaper laptop
